intro: Ceropegia pillansiana, commonly known as the Pillans' arrowroot, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and tuberous roots. The plant produces small, fragrant, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in umbels. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is adapted to survive in poor soil conditions. Its unique morphology and ornamental value make it a popular choice for succulent gardens.
